General Information

PETRONAS Penapisan (Terengganu) Sdn. Bhd. (PP(T)SB), PETRONAS' first oil refinery in Malaysia, was incorporated in 1982 to meet the needs for processing and add value to the indigenous crude from offshore Terengganu. Located in Kertih, Terengganu, PP(T)SB has the capacity of 124,000 barrels of crude oil per day with a proven capability to provide efficient, safe, reliable uninterrupted supply of petroleum products including gasoline, LPG, diesel, jet fuel, naphtha and Low Sulphur Waxy Residue (LSWR) to its domestic and international customers. The refinery has undergone expansion to include a Condensate Splitter Unit (KR-2A) with a rated capacity of 74,300 barrels per day of naphtha condensates. The heavy naphtha produced in KR-2A is used as feedstock in the aromatics plant located adjacent to the refinery.

PP(T)SB has been entrusted to manage and operate the Aromatics plant complex, which is 70% owned by PETRONAS Chemical Aromatics Sdn Bhd (PC AROMATICS) and 30% by Mitsubishi Corporation & JX Nippon Oil & Energy Corporation (MJPX Co. Limited), that produces paraxylene and benzene.

Quality and HSE ranks high in PP(T)SB’s business operations as it strives to ensure that existing petroleum products specifications are met. Its employees are regularly trained on strict HSE measures to inculcate and maintain a high level of awareness on the impact of the refinery’s operations to its natural surroundings. The company has won various certifications HSE recognition and awards as a testament to this pledge. It continues to build a strong safety culture through stringent regulations that monitors the safety and health of our employees as well as the environment.
